intro: Hymenolobus revelierei subsp. sommieri, commonly known as the Sommier's hymenolobus, is a rare and endemic plant species native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments within the rainforest undergrowth. It is notable for its unique floral structure and is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and potential ecological significance. Due to habitat loss, it is considered threatened and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
